hard_constraints.description: If we're dropping the most cash on a specific part, it better be the MVP of the build. Sanity check for budget justification.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: selected(X) :- selected_cpu(X). selected(X) :- selected_gpu(X). selected(X) :- selected_storage(X). max_cost(C) :- cost(C, V), V = #max {V1 : cost(C1, V1), selected(C1)}. max_perf(C) :- perf(C, V), V = #max {V1 : perf(C1, V1), selected(C1)}. :- selected(C), max_cost(C), not max_perf(C).

hard_constraints.description: Avoid maxing out every single slot. The bean counters don't want us picking the top-rated part for every category.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: top_cpu(C) :- cpu(C), perf(C, V), V = #max {V1 : perf(C1, V1), cpu(C1)}. top_gpu(C) :- gpu(C), perf(C, V), V = #max {V1 : perf(C1, V1), gpu(C1)}. top_storage(C) :- storage(C), perf(C, V), V = #max {V1 : perf(C1, V1), storage(C1)}. :- selected_cpu(C), top_cpu(C), selected_gpu(G), top_gpu(G), selected_storage(S), top_storage(S).

hard_constraints.description: Keep the component prices in the same ballpark. If the cost delta between any two parts is over $250, the build is a no-go.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: :- selected(C1), selected(C2), cost(C1, V1), cost(C2, V2), V1 - 250 >= V2.

hard_constraints.description: No bottlenecking allowed. The GPU shouldn't be outrunning the CPU or it's just wasted cycles.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: :- selected_cpu(C), selected_gpu(G), perf(C, PC), perf(G, PG), PG > PC.

hard_constraints.description: Hard skip on the Alpha8 and NovaX combo. They've got some nasty BIOS bugs when paired together.
FusionDrive is a diva and only works if it's paired with the ZetaCore chip.
